intro: Tetraneuris arizonica, commonly known as Arizona tetraneuris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets, and its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs. Tetraneuris arizonica is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities, demonstrating its adaptation to harsh, dry conditions.
